intro: Pachynocarpus verrucosus, commonly known as the rough-seeded pachygone, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, woody stems and small, clustered flowers. The plant produces distinctive, rough-surfaced fruits that are adapted for seed dispersal by wind. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, shaded environments. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
